bioghist.p: Samuel Taylor Coleridge (1772-1834) was a major English Romantic poet, a literary critic and a philosopher. His most famous works are The Rime of the Ancient Mariner and Kubla Khan. Hyman Hurwitz (1770-1844) was born at Posen in Poland and raised in the Jewish community there. He came to England about 1800 and opened a private academy for Jews at Highgate, Middlesex, where he became a close friend of Coleridge. Hurwitz was appointed the first Professor of Hebrew Language and Literature at the University of College London in 1828.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence from Samuel Taylor Coleridge to Hyman Hurwitz, regarding the latter's publication on the Talmud. The collection also includes a letter from John Taylor Coleridge and one to L. Horner, both related to Hurwitz's work. Each letter is accompanied by a typed transcription.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
